  • Reference

    Bureau of Labor Statistics Unemployment Data

    src_bls_unemployment_data.Rd

    Bureau of Labor Statistics Unemployment Data

    Usage

    src_bls_unemployment_data(...)

    Arguments

    ...

    passed to readr::read_tsv just in case....

    See also

    Other data accessors: src_acr_lung_cancer_screening_data(), src_brfss(), src_cdc_places_data(), src_epa_superfund_data(), src_epa_tri_data(), src_fda_mammography_data(), src_hrsa_facility_data(), src_nppes_gi_data(), src_nppes_onco_data()

    Examples

    
bls_unemployment = src_bls_unemployment_data()
#> INFO  [13:37:15.483] Starting bls_unemployment_data
#> INFO  [13:37:15.484] Reading url https://download.bls.gov/pub/time.series/la/la.series
#> INFO  [13:37:16.569] Reading url https://download.bls.gov/pub/time.series/la/la.footnote
#> INFO  [13:37:17.100] Reading url https://download.bls.gov/pub/time.series/la/la.data.64.County
#> INFO  [13:37:31.201] Reading url https://download.bls.gov/pub/time.series/la/la.data.65.City
#> INFO  [13:37:46.409] Completing bls_unemployment_data

colnames(bls_unemployment)
#>  [1] "series_id"      "year"           "period"         "value"         
#>  [5] "footnote_codes" "location_type"  "measure"        "location"      
#>  [9] "state"          "seasonal_adj"  

dplyr::glimpse(bls_unemployment)
